title: 'Citi Perspectives' Hosted for Corporate Clients
summary: Manila - Citi Philippines recently gathered the treasury and finance officials of corporate clients in an economic briefing entitled "Citi Perspectives." This event is one of several economic briefings held throughout the year for clients, offering relevant up-to-date information to help corporate clients map their financial future.
tag-2: Manila – Citi Philippines recently gathered the treasury and finance officials of corporate clients in an economic briefing entitled "Citi Perspectives." This event is one of several economic briefings held throughout the year for clients, offering relevant up-to-date information to help corporate clients map their financial future.
tag-3: In his opening message, Citi Philippines Country Officer Batara Sianturi thanked clients for their support and expressed Citi's commitment to providing value-added services such as this interactive forum. "We have invited subject-matter experts to offer their views and help you shape yours, especially as this is the time when most corporations begin planning sessions for the following year," said Sianturi.
tag-4: Giving an optimistic view of the Philippine economy, Sianturi added: "We have seen a very good first half with rising GDP, benign inflation, a strong external payments and fiscal position, and rating upgrades – the Philippines is poised for a record 2013 and hopefully an even better 2014."
tag-5: Citi Markets Head Arcus Fernando was also on hand to welcome guests. Leading the discussions onstage were Johanna Chua, Head of Citi Asia Pacific Economic and Market Analysis, and Jun Trinidad, Chief Economist for Citi Philippines and Thailand. Rolando Toledo, director of the fiscal planning bureau of the Department of Budget and Management, also gave a presentation and participated in the discussion.
tag-6: "If we look at markers around the world, the Philippines is in an enviable position, and it is our hope that the strong macro-economic foundation would usher in long-term investments from offshore. Despite the economic challenges in Europe and the growth risks in China, I believe that the joint commitment of the public and private sector to furthering progress in this country is key to keeping the Philippine economy on track to greater success," concluded Sianturi.
tag-7: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
